Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.name: isEmpty
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.abstract: Returns true, if yes, we have no bananas.

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.name: count
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.abstract: The number of elements we have. 1-based. 0 is no elements (isEmpty is true).

Protocols/RVS_DebugTools.html#/s:16RVS_B.name: isRunningUnitTests
Protocols/RVS_DebugTools.html#/s:16RVS_B.abstract: This is used to see whether or not we are running under unit tests. It is optional, and isn’t really supposed to be replaced.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverCommunicatorTools..name: reportThisError(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverCommunicatorTools..abstract: This method will kick the can up to the driver, where the error will finally be sent to the delegate.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverCommunicatorTools..name: sendInterfaceUpdate(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverCommunicatorTools..abstract: This method will send the driver delegate an update event, on behalf of a interface.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverCommunicatorTools..name: sendDeviceUpdate(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverCommunicatorTools..abstract: This method will send the driver delegate an update event, on behalf of a device.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: owner
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: This refers to the device instance that owns this service.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: properties
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: This is the public read-only access to the properties list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: uuid
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: This is the read-only unique ID for this service.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: count
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: This is the read-only count of properties.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: subscript(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: This is a public read-only subscript to the property list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: isThisInstanceASubscriber(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: Test to see if a subscriber is already subscribed.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: unsubscribe(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: remove a subscriber from the list. Nothing happens if the subscriber is not already subscribed.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceSubscriber.name: service(_:propertyAdded:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceSubscriber.abstract: OPTIONAL: Called When a property is added to the main list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceSubscriber.name: serviceStatusUpdate(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceSubscriber.abstract: OPTIONAL: Called to indicate that the service’s status should be checked.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: owner
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: This is a read-only accessor for the object that owns this instance.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.name: btDriver(_:encounteredThisError:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.abstract: Error reporting method. This is required for the delegate.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.name: btDriver(_:newDeviceAdded:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.abstract: Called when a device has been added and instantiated.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.name: btDriverStatusUpdate(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.abstract: Called to indicate that the driver’s status should be checked.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.name: btDriverScanningChanged(_:isScanning:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.abstract: Called to indicate that the driver started or stopped scanning.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.name: uuid
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.abstract: REQUIRED: This is a unique UUID that needs to be assigned to each instance, so we can match subscribers.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.name: setUpUUID()
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.abstract: DO NOT IMPLEMENT: This is a method that is called by the class handling the subscription.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: owner
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This refers to the driver instance that owns this device.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: uuid
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is a String, containing a unique ID for this peripheral.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: modelName
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a model name, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: manufacturerName
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a manufacturer name, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: serialNumber
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a manufacturer name, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: hardwareRevision
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a hardware revision, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: firmwareRevision
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a firmware revision, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: softwareRevision
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a software revision, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: services
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is the public read-only access to the service list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: isConnected
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is the public flag, determining whether or not the device is connected.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: count
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is the read-only count of services.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: subscript(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is a public read-only subscript to the service list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: isThisInstanceASubscriber(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: Test to see if a subscriber is already subscribed.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: unsubscribe(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: remove a subscriber from the list. Nothing happens if the subscriber is not already subscribed.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.name: device(_:serviceAdded:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.abstract: OPTIONAL: Called When a service is added to the main list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.name: deviceStatusUpdate(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.abstract: OPTIONAL: Called to indicate that the device’s status should be checked.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_VendorProtocol.ht.name: driver
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_VendorProtocol.ht.abstract: A reference to the main driver instance.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_VendorProtocol.ht.name: serviceSignatures
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_VendorProtocol.ht.abstract: These are the services that we scan for.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_VendorProtocol.ht.name: makeDevice(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_VendorProtocol.ht.abstract: REQUIRED: Factory method for creating an instance of the vendor device.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.name: state
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.abstract: This is the state of the instance.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.name: startInit()
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.abstract: Start whatever process is necessary to initialize.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.name: connectedPreInit()
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.abstract: Called if there was a connection, before initializing.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.name: discoveryPreInit()
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.abstract: Called if there was a discovery event, before initializing.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.name: connectedPostInit()
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.abstract: Called if there was a connection, after initializing.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.name: driver
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.abstract: A reference to the main driver instance.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.name: vendors
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.abstract: A list of the vendors that are users of this interface.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.name: serviceSignatures
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.abstract: This is an Array of String that aggregates any services we scan for. An empty Array means scan for everything.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.name: persistentConnection
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.abstract: This flag tells the driver to maintain a persistent connection (until explicitly disconneted).

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.name: rememberAdvertisedDevices
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.abstract: This flag tells the driver to remember devices that it discovers in a scan.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.name: makeInterface(queue:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.abstract: OPTIONAL (but actually required): This is a factory/accessor for the interface SINGLETON.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.name: isBTAvailable
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.abstract: OPTIONAL (but actually required): READ-ONLY. If true, then Bluetooth is available (powered on).

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.name: isScanning
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.abstract: OPTIONAL (but actually required): This is an on/off switch for scanning for peripherals.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.name: RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_InterfaceProtocol.abstract: This is a protocol that describes the basic transport abstraction for our bluetooth device connection. It will be specialized for Classic or BLE.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.name: RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine.htm.abstract: This protocol is an optional protocol that implements a state machine, where an instance can go from unitialized, to initialized.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.name: RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.abstract: This is a protocol for classes, structs or enums that want to subscribe to a device.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.name: RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.abstract: This is a base subscriber protocol for accessing driver elements.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html.name: RVS_BTDriverDelegate
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html.abstract: This is the delegate for the driver instance. You should definitely do this.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: This represents the public face of a property, which maps to a bluetooth characteristic.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverCommunicatorTools..name: RVS_BTDriverCommunicatorTools
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverCommunicatorTools..abstract: This protocol allows aggregated instances to report stuff through the main driver, without breaking the fourth wall.

Protocols/RVS_DebugTools.html.name: RVS_DebugTools
Protocols/RVS_DebugTools.html.abstract: This protocol is a junk drawer of vrious debug/testing tools.

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html.name: RVS_SequenceProtocol
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html.abstract: If you conform to this protocol, you get a few basic Sequence attributes for free.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: stringValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: The data, cast to a String (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: intValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: The data, cast to an Integer (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: boolValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: The data, cast to a Boolean (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: floatValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: The data, cast to a double-precision float (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: rawValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: The data is not able to be cast, and is returned as the raw Data type.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: undefinedValue
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: This is returned if the data is nil, or an undefined type (no associated value).

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine_StateEn.name: RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine_StateEnum
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine_StateEn.abstract: This is an enum that is used to indicate the state of the instance that conforms to the RVS_BTDriver_State_Machine protocol.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type_Enum
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: This enum is used to cast a property value into its proper data type.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_GoTenna_Mesh.name: uuid
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: This is a String, containing a unique ID for this peripheral.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.name: goTennaProprietary
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: This is the basic goTenna proprietary service.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.name: RVS_BLE_GATT_UUID
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: These are String-based enums that we use to reference various services and characteristics in our driver.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.name: _manufacturerCode
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: This is the data we need to match against the advertisement data.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.name: interface
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: Read-only accessor for the interface. This is a weak reference.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.name: internal_driver
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: A weak reference to the main driver instance.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.name: driver
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: A read-only accessor to the main driver instance.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.name: serviceSignatures
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: These are the services that we scan for. In our case, it is simply the goTenna proprietary service.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.name: makeDevice(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: REQUIRED: Factory method for creating an instance of the vendor device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.name: makeInterface(queue:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: Factory for creating (or referencing) the appropriate interface instance.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service.html#/s:16R.abstract: Main initializer.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service.html#/s:16R.abstract: This method will move a property from the holding pen to the main list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service.html#/s:16R.name: addPropertyToMainList(_:)

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service.html#/s:16R.name: reportCompletion()

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service.html#/s:16R.abstract: Add an observer of the service.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.name: unsubscribe(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.abstract: remove a subscriber from the list. Nothing happens if the subscriber is not already subscribed.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.name: moveServiceFromHoldingPenToMainList(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This method will move a service from the holding pen to the main list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.name: removeThisService(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This method will remove a service from the holding pen or the main list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.name: reportCompletion()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.abstract: Called to report that our holding pen is empty.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.name: reportThisError(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This method will kick the can up to the driver, where the error will finally be sent to the delegate.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.name: services
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is the public read-only access to the service list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.name: count
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is the read-only count of services.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is a public read-only subscript to the service list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.name: bluetoothNotAvailable
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is returned if the manager can’t power on.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.name: connectionAttemptFailed(error:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is returned if we cannot connect to the device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.name: connectionAttemptFailedNoDevice
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is returned if we connected, but no device was available. This should never happen.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.name: disconnectionAttemptFailed(error:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is returned if we cannot disconnect from the device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.name: unknownDisconnectionError
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is a catchall error for a disconnection issue

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.name: unknownPeripheralDiscoveryError(error:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is a catchall error for peripheral discovery

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.name: characteristicValueMissing
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This means that we did not get a characteristic value

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.name: unknownCharacteristicsDiscoveryError(error:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is a catchall error for characteristics discovery

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.name: unknownCharacteristicsReadValueError(error:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.abstract: This is a catchall error for characteristics value read

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.name: localizedDescription
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:16RV.abstract: The localized description is a simple slug that can be used to key a client-supplied message.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: _device_list
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This contains the device list for this instance of the driver.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: internal_AllowDuplicatesInBLEScan
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This is a flag that specifies that the scanner can be continuously running, and re-finding duplicate devices.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: internal_stayConnected
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This is a flag that tells us to remain connected continuously, until explicitly disconnected by the user. Default is false.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: internal_holding_pen
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This contains instances that have not yet passed a credit check.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: internal_queue
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This contains any queue we’re supposed to use. Nil (default) is the main queue.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: internal_delegate
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: The delegate. It is a weak reference.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: internal_vendors
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This will contain our vendor factory instances. This is loaded at instantiation time.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: init(_:queue:allowDuplicatesInBLEScan:stayConnected:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: The main internal initializer.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/c:@M@RVS_BTDr.name: deinit
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/c:@M@RVS_BTDr.abstract: Make sure that everything is put back the way we found it…

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: moveDeviceFromHoldingPenToMainList(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This method will move a device from the holding pen to the main list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: triageHoldingPen()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This method runs through our holding pen, and will start device on their initialization (if not started), or move them to the completed queue, if they are done.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: removeThisDevice(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This method will remove a device from the holding pen or the main list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: reportCompletion()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: Called to report that our holding pen is empty.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: reportThisError(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: The buck stops here.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: sendInterfaceUpdate(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This method will send the driver delegate an update event, on behalf of a interface.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: sendDeviceUpdate(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This method will send the driver delegate an update event, on behalf of a device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: Element
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: We aggregate devices.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: sequence_contents
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: This is a public read-only list of devices, masked by the protocol.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: Simple String Key subscript, so we can treat the array as a dictionary.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: delegate
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: A weak reference to the instance delegate.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: startScanning()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: Tells the vendor interfaces (all of them) to start scanning for services.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: stopScanning()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: Tells the vendor interfaces to stop scanning.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: removeDevice(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: Removes an indicated device from our list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.name: init(delegate:queue:allowDuplicatesInBLEScan:stayConnected:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:16RVS_BTDri.abstract: The main initializer.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BTD.name: description
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BTD.abstract: This is a simplified, readable description of the instance that should be quite useful.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: systemIDStruct
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: This characteristic represents a structure containing an Organizationally Unique Identifier (OUI) followed by a manufacturer-defined identifier and is unique for each individual instance of the product.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: modelNumberString
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: This characteristic represents the model number that is assigned by the device vendor.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: serialNumberString
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: This characteristic represents the serial number for a particular instance of the device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: firmwareRevisionString
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: This characteristic represents the firmware revision for the firmware within the device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: hardwareRevisionString
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: This characteristic represents the hardware revision for the hardware within the device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: softwareRevisionString
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: This characteristic represents the software revision for the software within the device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: manufacturerNameString
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: This characteristic represents the name of the manufacturer of the device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: ieeRegulatoryList
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: This characteristic represents regulatory and certification information for the product in a list defined in IEEE 11073-20601.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: pnpIDSet
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: The PnP_ID characteristic is a set of values used to create a device ID value that is unique for this device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: RVS_BLE_GATT_UUID
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: This is a list of the UUIDs for the standard Device Info charateristics.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: discoverInitialCharacteristics()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: Start a discovery process for basic characteristics (properties).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: cbCharacteristic
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: The CB characteristic associated with this instance.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: canBroadcast
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: True, if the characteristic can broadcast its value.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: canRead
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: True, if the characteristic can be read.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: canWrite
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: True, if the characteristic can be written, with or without a response.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: canWriteWithResponse
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: True, if the characteristic can be written, with a response.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: canWriteWithoutResponse
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: True, if the characteristic can be written, without a response.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: canIndicate
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: True, if the characteristic can indicate. The driver need sto respond to indications.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: canHaveAuthenticatedSignedWrites
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: True, if the characteristic can have authenticated signed writes, without a response.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: isEncryptionRequiredForNotify
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: Only trusted devices can subscribe to notifications of this property.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: isEncryptionRequiredForIndication
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: Only trusted devices can see indications of this property.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.name: executeUpdate()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html#/.abstract: This is called when the property is updated.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html#/s.name: cbService
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html#/s.abstract: The CB service associated with this instance.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html#/s.name: discoverInitialCharacteristics()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html#/s.abstract: Start a discovery process for all characteristics (properties).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html#/s.name: propertyInstanceForCBCharacteristic(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html#/s.abstract: This searches the service, and returns a property that owns the given characteristic.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html#/s.name: propertyInstanceForCBUUID(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html#/s.abstract: This searches the service, and returns a property for the given characteristic, identified by its UUID (as a String).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html#/s.name: addPropertyToList(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html#/s.abstract: This adds a new property to the holding pen (if it can read), where an update will be requested, or directly into the main list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: centralManager
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: The central manager that controls this peripheral.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: peripheral
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: The peripheral instance associated with this device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: _state
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: The initial state (unititialized).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: internal_initalServiceDiscovery
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: These are the services that we look up upon initialization connection.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: modelName
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a model name, it is available here.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: manufacturerName
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a manufacturer name, it is available here.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: serialNumber
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a serial number, it is available here.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: hardwareRevision
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a hardware revision, it is available here.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: firmwareRevision
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a firmware revision, it is available here.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: softwareRevision
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a software revision, it is available here.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: isConnected
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: Connection indicator.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: connect()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: Called to initiate a connection.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: disconnect()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: Called to close a connection.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: serviceInstanceForCBCharacteristic(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: This searches the device, and returns a service that owns the given characteristic.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: propertyInstanceForCBCharacteristic(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: This searches the device, and returns a property that owns the given characteristic.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: propertyInstanceForCBUUID(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: This searches the device, and returns a property that owns the given characteristic, identified by its UUID (as a String).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: state
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: The current state of this instance.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: startInit()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: Start initialization.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: connectedPreInit()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: Called if there was a connection, before initializing.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: discoveryPreInit()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: Called if there was a service discovery event, before initializing.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: abortInit()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: Abort initialization.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: connectedPostInit()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: Called if there was a connection, after initializing.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.name: disconnectedPostInit()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/s:.abstract: Called if there was a disconnection, after initializing.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/c:.name: peripheral(_:didDiscoverServices:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html#/c:.abstract: Called when we have discovered services for the peripheral.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE/Devic.name: advertisementData
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE/Devic.abstract: Any advertising data supplied with the discovery.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE/Devic.name: DeviceInfoStruct
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE/Devic.abstract: This is a simple struct to transfer interface information between the interface and the vendor device implementation.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.name: DeviceInfo
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.abstract: This is how we get the information for creating our device instance.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.name: _RSSI_range
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.abstract: This is the signal strength range. Optimal is -50.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.name: makeInterface(queue:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.abstract: This will create the SINGLETON, if it is not already created, or simply returns the one we have.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.name: centralManager
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.abstract: The manager instance associated with this interface. There is only one.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.name: isBTAvailable
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.abstract: If true, then Bluetooth is available (powered on).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.name: isScanning
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.abstract: Start or stop the scan for new peripherals.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.name: centralManagerDidUpdateState(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.abstract: Callback for when the central manager changes state.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.name: centralManager(_:didDiscover:advertisementData:rssi:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html#.abstract: Callback for a device discovered during scanning.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.name: driver
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.abstract: A weak reference to the main driver instance.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.name: serviceSignatures
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.abstract: This is an Array of String that aggregates any services we scan for. An empty Array means scan for everything.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.name: persistentConnection
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.abstract: This flag tells the driver to maintain a persistent connection (until explicitly disconneted).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.name: vendors
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.abstract: A list of the vendors that are users of this interface.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.name: rememberAdvertisedDevices
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.abstract: This flag tells the driver to remember devices that it discovers in a scan.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.name: isBTAvailable
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.abstract: You cannot use the base class version of this. This is just here to satisfy the protocol.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.name: isScanning
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.abstract: You cannot use the base class version of this. This is just here to satisfy the protocol.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.name: RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Base_Interface.html.abstract: This is the base class for our transport abstractions.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html.name: RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Interface_BLE.html.abstract: This is an interface for Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE), using CoreBluetooth.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html.name: RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_BLE.html.abstract: This is a specialized class for BLE devices (peripherals).

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html.name: RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_BLE.html.abstract: This implements a way for the driver to track our initialization progress.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html.name: RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property_BLE.html.abstract: This implements a way for the driver to track our initialization progress.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.name: RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_BLE
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Service_DeviceInfo_.abstract: This implements a way for the driver to track our initialization progress.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html.name: RVS_BTDriver
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html.abstract: This is the main driver class. It is the manager for all the bluetooth-connected devices, which are accessible as RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol-conformant instances.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html.name: RVS_BTDriver_Device
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device.html.abstract: This is one device, which maps to a bluetooth peripheral.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property.html.name: RVS_BTDriver_Property
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Property.html.abstract: This is one property, which maps to a bluetooth characteristic.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.name: RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: A factory class for goTenna Mesh devices

Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_GoTenna_Mesh.name: RVS_BTDriver_Device_GoTenna_Mesh
Classes/RVS_BTDriver_Device_GoTenna_Mesh.abstract: This is a specialization of the device for the goTenna Mesh.
